prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top and Bottom Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with Euler angles of [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Create a single circle loop in the sketch, with its center at [0.25, 0.25] and a radius of 0.25. Extrude the sketch by a depth of 0.375 towards the normal and a depth of 0.0 in the opposite direction. Use a sketch scale of 0.5. The resulting object will be a slightly tapered cylinder. Part 2: Cylindrical Object with Three Extension Towards Top Create a new coordinate system at [0.375, 0.0484, 0.1125] with Euler angles of [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the same translation vector. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Create a circle loop at [0.05, 0.05] with a radius of 0.05, this will be the base of the first extension. Create a loop with 3 curves. * Curve 1: Arc with start point at [0.2016, 0.2625] end point at [0.2516, 0.3125] and mid point at [0.1662, 0.3479]. * Curve 2: Line with start point at [0.2516, 0.3125] end point at [0.2016, 0.3125] * Curve 3: Line with start point at [0.2016, 0.3125] end point at [0.2016, 0.2625] Create another loop with 3 curves mirroring the first loop * Curve 1: Arc with start point at [0.2016, 0.2625] end point at [0.2516, 0.3125] and mid point at [0.2369, 0.2771]. * Curve 2: Line with start point at [0.2516, 0.3125] end point at [0.2016, 0.3125] * Curve 3: Line with start point at [0.2016, 0.3125] end point at [0.2016, 0.2625] Create a circle at [0.3531, 0.05] with radius 0.05 this will be base of the second extension. Extrude the sketch by a depth of 0.375 towards the normal and a depth of 0.0 in the opposite direction. Use a sketch scale of 0.4031. The resulting object will be a cylindrical object with three extensions towards the top.</description>
